description: Generally speaking, the public in Europe remains committed to the common currency of the euro, even as the region struggles to fight off recession. A major Apple announcement is expected today surrounding e-textbooks. As the South Carolina primary approaches, we speak to a Tea Party supporter about who she will vote for. And what is the significance of the leap second?
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, January 19, 2012
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, January 19, 2012
byline: Jeremy Hobson, Sam Beard, Eve Troeh, Stacey Vanek Smith, Amy Scott, Frank Newport, Adrienne Hill, Christopher Werth, Diane Swonk and Mary Dooe
teaser: Generally speaking, the public in Europe remains committed to the common currency of the euro, even as the region struggles to fight off recession. A major Apple announcement is expected today surrounding e-textbooks. As the South Carolina primary approaches, we speak to a Tea Party supporter about who she will vote for. And what is the significance of the leap second?
